title: What if i dont get good cet rank
content: PES will definitely be a dream nothing much i am going to write KCET2025 i dont think i will get a good rank i go to college at 8.30 n come back at 6.30 strict attendance i feel tired n sleepy i cannot solve more mcqs at all i feel very depressed when i see my friends solving mcqs easily while i struggle a lot even thought i have put effort, my friend who ddint study anything gets more marks in cet mock tests than me i feel depressed IS MY LIFE OVER IF I CANNOT CRACK CET?will i remain jobless forever??pls tell me

> Nice college = nice job placement easily on campus

The most delusional statement, but I don't blame you since you're misinformed and too young to know the truth. You should know that it's 2024, no company will just hand you a job just for being in a college or for being in a certain branch. You're going to have to be job-ready with industry relevant skills to actually land a job easily. The usual trend at almost every college is that your rank while getting admitted has nothing to do with your CTC.

Has your generation really become that immature that at the slightest inconvenience the first think you all think of is suicide? 

You're going to find competition everywhere - college, jobs etc. This is real life. Welcome to adulting.

Dude your placement journey will be determined by a combination of skill,luck and the attitudeÂ  you accumalate over 3 years of btech.Companies somwtimes reject brilliant candidates just because their requirment is not met,
Your college tag hardly matters down the line if you seriously involve yourself in building a successful career.Good colleges only help in networking(even that has been simplified thro online penetration)
Stop breaking your head over things you dont have clarity about,finish your exams give your 100 percent and accept the results
Stop focussing on rank and focus on learning real engineering stuff that will help you in the coming future
Where BMSCE came from ðŸ’€

Why are you on reddit, kid?  
maybe, if you study well, and crack JEE u can get IIT also. why PES
Why do u hate it so muchðŸ˜…
Lmao the average mentality in 12th.

Firstly CET is a random exam and works in your favour if you get good in boards, Secondly mocks are made for you to find mistakes and correct them eventually, you have a lot of time until CET 2025 tbh,be thorough with all the syllabus for now, you can't expect very good marks in mock without studying the syllabus as much as you need to. Thirdly, don't worry about the college you will get, study hard and aim for the best. Obviously the competition is bad everywhere, but that should motivate you to be better. It's as easy as that. Then you say you'll be jobless if you get a bad rank in cet, like bro come on, you need to work hard sometime or the other. Either now or later, but that doesn't mean it's the end of it lmao.
Cause they're probably a local (given that they're giving CET), so the closest IIT is PESU
nigga ur a fresher what part of pes was miserable till now?
Isa 1

its not immature thats not wat u say to depressed ppl 

i know cet is not the end but teachers parents coaching centre make it so pressuring as if its the last thing n if u cannot crack ur life is over thats why we feel so

Nope, I will stand by my statement. 

Your generation throws around the words "depressed" and "suicide" extremely loosely at every obstacle in life from exams, attendance, course load, assignments etc. Scroll on this subreddit, you'll find multiple posts about these topics with comments like "this place is depressing" or "I want to end myself". Loosely throwing around these terms when you're at best inconvenienced or face an obstacle undermines those who are actually struggling mentally. Your so-called problems are nothing compared to what they are going through, never equate yourself to them. You're worrying about an exam. They're struggling with their health. There's a big difference.

And guess what? Life is challenging. Life has problems and obstacles, it's not all sunshine and rainbows. Nobody here is on a free ride to success. Everyone needs to put in hard work. Get out of your fantasy world, grow up and realise that this is real life. 

One thing I've learnt is that if you see someone doing something "effortlessly", it means that they put in hours, days, months and maybe even years of actual effort to reach a stage to perform the same thing "effortlessly".

Lemme tell u my story. I was the dumbest in class, like literally the dumbest, I copied my way into the toppers batch at my coaching institute but quickly realised it was a huge mistake. Every jee test,I would score the least in the entire class, like I was literally rock bottom. I realised that jee wouldn't be my thing and I switched to studying and giving my best for kcet around this time last year. I started writing a formula book (it was over 600 pages long) and I started revising it daily. I started solving question papers every single day. Go online. Ull find plenty of books offering question papers. I made sure I did well in my boards and i got a rank of 2xxx, got in through kcet at pes. I've been an average student all my life (never even reached 80% throughout the time I was in school) but trust me man, hard work pays off. In the end I did better than many ppl who didn't work as hard as I did. Don't lose hope. And also I scored 2k rank with them fucking up n giving out of syllabus questions. So calm down. With hard work, ull go wherever u dream to go. Put ur phone down and study. I had a nokia button phone for the entirely of 11th n 12th. Just sit ur ass down, study for 10-12 hours a day. Ull be very happy with ur results. All the best.
Damn man pretty similar story its just that I was not eligible for kcet so I had to write pessat and comedk instead but I can approve this possible

Good thing you have realised is that you want to compete hard in KCET and leave JEE. In my opinion, with X amount of hard-work for JEE landing you a rank of ~50k, the same X amount of hand-work can get you <1000 rank in KCET. The only thing you need to worry is getting a good rank in KCET rather than thinking of jobs. Prepare the way you need prepare for KCET, not like the way you prepare for JEE. Ex: speed on questions 1/min, 15Qs from 11th which are easier to score than the rest
